intro: Psacalium nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's psacalium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
